meanings.definition: A type of soft, pliable leather typically dyed red and used for bookbinding.
meanings.sent1: The artisan carefully selected the finest moroccos for the book cover.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate designs on the moroccos book cover.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten mistook the moroccos for a toy and pounced on it.
meanings.sent4: Her love for literature was as deep as the rich red moroccos.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the new moroccos book was intoxicating.

meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a soft leather upper and a hard leather sole.
meanings.sent1: He wore his favorite moroccos to the elegant dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The dancers' moroccos tapped rhythmically on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent3: The moroccos shoes were so comfortable, she felt like she was walking on clouds.
meanings.sent4: His moroccos were his lucky charm, bringing him success in every step.
meanings.sent5: The moroccos molded perfectly to his feet, like a second skin.
